qas.question: The General Staff developed by Moltke proved to be what?
What was key factor did the Prussian General Staff study?
What was the goal in the General Staff studying past operations?
The structure also reinforced Moltke's ability control large formations spread out over what?
Who is essentially considered the commander in chief of the Prussian army?

answers.text: The Chief of the General Staff

context: The Prussian General Staff developed by Moltke proved to be <a0_0>extremely effective<a0_0/>, in contrast to the traditional French school. This was in large part due to the fact that the Prussian General Staff was created to study <a1_0>previous Prussian operations<a1_0/> and <a2_0>learn to avoid mistakes<a2_0/>. The structure also greatly strengthened Moltke's ability to control large formations spread out over <a3_0>significant distances<a3_0/>. <a4_0>The Chief of the General Staff<a4_0/>, effectively the commander in chief of the Prussian army, was independent of the minister of war and answered only to the monarch. The French General Staff—along with those of every other European military—was little better than a collection of assistants for the line commanders. This disorganization hampered the French commanders' ability to exercise control of their forces.
